name: Cervical - Muscle Energy
indications: Restricted cervical motion, muscular hypertonicity.
contraindications: Fracture, severe arthritis, vertebral artery insufficiency.
instructions: 1. Assess restricted cervical motion.
2. Position patient to engage the barrier.
3. Instruct patient to gently resist your counterforce for 3-5 seconds.
4. Relax and reposition to new barrier.
5. Repeat 3-5 times until motion improves.

name: Thoracic HVLA - Type I Dysfunction
indications: Somatic dysfunction of thoracic spine with Type I characteristics.
contraindications: Fracture, osteoporosis, malignancy, spinal instability.
instructions: 1. Identify the Type I segmental dysfunction.
2. Position the patient supine with arms crossed.
3. Localize the segment with flexion, sidebending, and rotation.
4. Apply a posterior HVLA thrust through the barrier.
5. Reassess segment motion and tenderness.

name: Rib 1 - Muscle Energy (Inhalation)
indications: Inhalation dysfunction of first rib, scalene hypertonicity.
contraindications: Fracture of rib or clavicle, severe neck trauma.
instructions: 1. Position patient seated, operator behind.
2. Sidebend patient’s head toward rib dysfunction.
3. Apply downward pressure on rib while patient inhales and resists.
4. Relax and reposition deeper on exhalation.
5. Repeat 3-5 times, reassess.

name: Plantar Fascia Release - Myofascial
indications: Plantar fasciitis, foot pain, fascial restriction.
contraindications: Open wounds, severe inflammation, recent surgery.
instructions: 1. Patient supine or seated.
2. Use thumbs to apply traction along the fascia from heel to toes.
3. Maintain tension and sweep slowly across foot.
4. Repeat until tissue softens or pain decreases.

name: Lumbar - Counterstrain (Posterior L3)
indications: Tenderpoint at posterior L3 area, low back pain.
contraindications: Fracture, spinal infection, patient intolerance to positioning.
instructions: 1. Locate the L3 tenderpoint 2/3 distance from ASIS to midline.
2. Patient prone, flex hips and knees to shorten area.
3. Add slight sidebending away from tenderpoint.
4. Hold for 90 seconds, maintaining light pressure.
5. Slowly return to neutral and reassess.

name: Cervical - Muscle Energy Copy 6
indications: Restricted cervical motion, muscular hypertonicity.
contraindications: Fracture, severe arthritis, vertebral artery insufficiency.

4. Relax and reposition to new barrier.
5. Repeat 3-5 times until motion improves.

name: Rib 1 - Muscle Energy (Inhalation) Copy 68
indications: Inhalation dysfunction of first rib, scalene hypertonicity.
contraindications: Fracture of rib or clavicle, severe neck trauma.
instructions: 1. Position patient seated, operator behind.
2. Sidebend patient’s head toward rib dysfunction.
3. Apply downward pressure on rib while patient inhales and resists.
4. Relax and reposition deeper on exhalation.
5. Repeat 3-5 times, reassess.

name: Plantar Fascia Release - Myofascial Copy 69
indications: Plantar fasciitis, foot pain, fascial restriction.
contraindications: Open wounds, severe inflammation, recent surgery.
instructions: 1. Patient supine or seated.
2. Use thumbs to apply traction along the fascia from heel to toes.
3. Maintain tension and sweep slowly across foot.
4. Repeat until tissue softens or pain decreases.

name: Lumbar - Counterstrain (Posterior L3) Copy 70
indications: Tenderpoint at posterior L3 area, low back pain.
contraindications: Fracture, spinal infection, patient intolerance to positioning.
instructions: 1. Locate the L3 tenderpoint 2/3 distance from ASIS to midline.
2. Patient prone, flex hips and knees to shorten area.
3. Add slight sidebending away from tenderpoint.
4. Hold for 90 seconds, maintaining light pressure.
5. Slowly return to neutral and reassess.

name: Cervical - Muscle Energy Copy 71
indications: Restricted cervical motion, muscular hypertonicity.
contraindications: Fracture, severe arthritis, vertebral artery insufficiency.
instructions: 1. Assess restricted cervical motion.
2. Position patient to engage the barrier.
3. Instruct patient to gently resist your counterforce for 3-5 seconds.
4. Relax and reposition to new barrier.
5. Repeat 3-5 times until motion improves.

name: Thoracic HVLA - Type I Dysfunction Copy 72
indications: Somatic dysfunction of thoracic spine with Type I characteristics.
contraindications: Fracture, osteoporosis, malignancy, spinal instability.
instructions: 1. Identify the Type I segmental dysfunction.
2. Position the patient supine with arms crossed.
3. Localize the segment with flexion, sidebending, and rotation.
4. Apply a posterior HVLA thrust through the barrier.
5. Reassess segment motion and tenderness.
